de.frauas.jdemandmodel.util

Class JDMTimeConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.frauas.jdemandmodel.util.JDMTimeConverter

  • public class JDMTimeConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is for converting data produced by the OccupancyModeler and Simulator to the specified time interval length.
    Author:
    lukas

    • Method Detail

      • getTimeIntervalLength

        public static int getTimeIntervalLength()
        Returns:
        the time interval length / time resolution.

      • setTimeIntervalLength

        public static void setTimeIntervalLength(int timeIntervalLength)
        Sets the time interval length / time resolution.
        Parameters:
        timeIntervalLength - an integer between 1 and 1440 inclusive.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter is outside this range

      • expandToMAX_TIME_INTERVAL_COUNT

        public static int[] expandToMAX_TIME_INTERVAL_COUNT(int[] data)
        This method can be used to expand an integer array of length 144 to an integer array of length 1440. The method will simply turn one field into ten fields holding the same value.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to be expanded (length must be 144)
        Returns:
        an integer array of length 1440 including the same data as in the original array.

      • convert

        public static Matrix convert(Matrix matrix)
        This method converts a whole matrix of length 1440 to another length. As the matrix is expected to hold electricity demand data for 1440 1-minute time intervals in each column, each column is saved in a new array and then passed to the private "convert" method that only takes one array instead of matrix. This method does the actual conversion. Finally, the new arrays are put together to a matrix again.
        Parameters:
        matrix - electricity demand data such as produced by a Simulator
        Returns:
        a converted matrix with the average demand of each newly sized time interval.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the passed matrix has any length other than 1440

      • convert

        private static int[] convert(int[] data,
                             int timeResolution)
        This method does the actual conversion, as it adds up all values that will be summarized in a new time interval and divides the result by the time resolution. This way, the result will contain the average electricity demand in each time interval.
        Parameters:
        data - the integer array to be converted
        timeResolution - the new time interval length the array should be converted to
        Returns:
        a converted integer array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the passed array has any length other than 1440
